title: Drawing, "Costume Design: Queen's Servant", 1913
medium: Graphite, brush and watercolor, silver and gold paint, pen and black ink on paper mounted on board
signed: Signed in graphite,  lower left: BAKST
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at upper left: Serves de la Reine avec fruits; in upper right: Pisanella III Acte.
provenance: Gift of Mrs. G. Macculloch Miller
creditline: Gift of Mrs. G. Macculloch Miller
description: Figure facing left wearing Turkish-style costume with bright blue and white turban, blue trousers with gold circles pattern, and white sash, designed for the servant of the queen in the third act of Pisanella: La Morte Parfumee.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Costume Design: Queen's Servant", 1913.
1913. Graphite, brush and watercolor, silver and gold paint, pen and black ink on paper mounted on board. Gift of Mrs. G. Macculloch Miller. 1947-77-1.
